text: On tap at the brewery. Our kids shoes exploded. Dark brown with a lasting medium beige head, Aroma of herbs, burnt bacon, smoke, burnt matches. Flavour has nuts, more chocolate and coffee than aroma, tasted roasted malt finish. Maybe not a typical mild but all the more tasty for it.
Bottle at home, exploded everywhere. Deep black, roasted chocolate nose, dry and chocolatey, light roast.

Bottle (330 ml). Murky amber-brown with a small fully lasting beige head and good lacing. Aroma is earthy/mineral with caramel, smokey notes and light fruits. Taste is slightly sweet with smoke, mineral notes, caramel, fruity notes and light bitterness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Slightly dry finish. The bottle was bit old, but its still really tasty and pretty drinkable. Its not faire that this one is a mild though, it should at least be an Imperial Mild. ;-)

Keg at the Bat ... deep brown ... thin uan ;acing ... soft dark roast malt nose ... soft chewy roast malts ... woody malts ..dry finsihEarlier Rating: 7/27/2013 Total Score: 3.8bottle at home ... deep brown ... big tan head ... soft deep mellow chocolate roast nose ... soft toffee malts ... mellow dark berry fruits ... woody chocolate malts .. mellow smooth and tasty

Keg at The Hanging Bat. Hazy brown body with a thick off-white head. Excellent lacing. Aroma of nuts, brown sugar and dark sugar. Flavour of brown bread, almonds, Twiglets dust and earth. Medium body with a smooth, oily texture. Light carbonation. A rich, flavoursome beer with very little hop character.

330ml bottle. Pours brown with muchos foam. Intriguing aroma. An awful lot of smoky bacon plus soft fruitier tangerine and hops as well. Tastes less smoky, perhaps more nutty. Light coffee and tobacco notes. Quite a creamy palate. Interesting stuff but not the king of milds.

Bottle @ Home. Almost pitch black, almost no head or lacing. Nice coating. Pours thick, almost like oil. Aroma, malty, roasted notes, caramel, molasses, coffee, berries. Taste, malty, roasted notes, peber, coffee, dark bitter chocolate, molasses, . Not the beer I expected, at all. Oily mouth feel. Low carbonation. Bitter roasted aftertaste, with a lot of coffee. BB 16/04/14

330ml bottle from Great Grog. Lumpy fucker. Pours in chunks. Clear dark red-brown, with floaters. Big fruity nose, lots of blackcurrant. Light roast. Sweet on the taste, light roast bitter, and yeasty. Oily texture. Fruity lingering finish, and a light sourness. Interesting, unsure as to whether it was what they were actually going for though...

Bottled, 330ml from S.H Jones, Banbury. Reddish brown with white head. There is a rich, malty character to this, chocolate bitterness with a roasted nutty sideline. Malty bitterness, some fruitiness but not too much. A decent beer, certainly not an atypical Mild though, but good all the same.

Bottle from Ales By Mail [230314] BBE 19/06/14
Very dark caramel brown, huge off white frothy head, some lacing
Aroma of soft roasted malts, tad of yeast, slight dark fruits, light aroma
Taste of soft roasted malts, smooth plain chocolate, dark fruity malts, dab of raisin, touch of lactose?
Palate - soft carb, medium body, smooth texture. Finish as main flavour, soft bitter roast, dark bitter chocolate
Overall - Quite a nice porter, but not as good as I was expecting
nice nuts and toast aroma,golden, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, soft carbonation, nice full tast finish.
Brown coloured and hazy. Has an off-white head, lasting Nutty aroma, faint wood and hazel. Flavor starts sweet, faint chocolate, moderate bitter finish. Creamy texture.
Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Red amber colour. Heavy malty and light hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Woody nutty notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

Bottle at home from ales by mail dark chestnut with lacing of tan head with blackcurrant and chocolate on nose. Light carbonation and full bodied, initial fruity burst, cocoa, light toast, touch of barley, plum skins, touch of heather honey sweetness and a long dry finish.

330 ml bottle from Ales By Mail, served in a pint glass. Bottled on 19-06-2013. Ruby red/copper colour with a nice, big, light beige/yellow head. Good lacing. Aroma of wild type of fruits (red and black berries), mou candy/toffee, white chocolate, coffee powder and a bit of cinnamon. It does share some porter qualities, especially roasted malts and coffee/chocolate bitterness, but in a completely different way. More creamy, more balanced and easy to drink. I can imagine this being glorious on cask. Medium body and soft carbonation. with an oily sensation that coats the lips during every sip. I wasnt ready at all for such a good beer, I could see my self chugging down 3-4 pints of this beer easily. Great!
330ml bottle from Good Spirits CO. Very dark brown, flat, no head. Sweet coffee malt aroma & flavour. Sweet aftertaste. Noce flavour but I would prefer some fizz.

0,33 l bottle. Dark brown with limited clarity. Low beige head. Gently roasted dark malts, creamed dark caramel and hint of chocolate to the nose. Mid-bodied and smooth. Taste is dominated by roasted dark malts, maybe more than expected for a Mild. Firm bitterness, dark creamed caramel and and some gentle tones of dark dried fruits. Light bitter and roasty malt finish.
Mørk nesten svart farve med lite beige skum. Lukt av malt og sjokolade. Smak av malt, sjokolade og kaffe. Melkebaren.
Duft av humle, karamell og eik. Fin mørk kastanjebrun farge. Lite skum. Smak av karamell og eik.

8/X/13 - 33cl bottle @ home - BB: 16/IV/14, bottled: 16/IV/13 (2013-934) Thanks to Mike and Nicki for transporting the bottles!
Clear deep purple brown beer, no head, little bit of bubbles. Aroma: mocha, fudge, toast, caramel, little sweet, red fruit candy. MF: soft to almost no carbon, light to medium body. Taste: mocha, little citrus, coffee, sour touch, bitter, grains, pretty hoppy. Aftertaste: some chocolate, mocha, hops, coffee, bitter touch, some dried forest fruits.

Sampled from a 0.33l bottle @ Haandfest 2013. This one pours a deep dark purple brown body with a really small islandy and light sidesticking top. The nose is, wait for it.. Not all that mild! Lots if mild chocolate paper and dark malts. Hints if cold coffee and cake as well. Actually one if the most interesting miles Ive nosed. Oh yeah, this is tasty! Really tasty for a mild. You can sense that its a mild, but in a way its much more pungent and powerful. About average on the carbonation level and it actually has a good oily mouthfeel. More biscuits and chocolate. Something light herbal also. Heather? Not bad at all, could definitely be one of the best mild Ive ever had. 25.05.2013

Bottle dark brown nearly black Body lasting tan head roasted malts Aroma with hints of sourness very Full and oily Body taste is roasted malts some caramell aftertaste is bitter with roasted malts interresting brew good One

Bottle 0.33l at home (via alesbymail). Bottled on 19/06/2013. Best Before 19/07/2013. Colour is dark brown with large wihte head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, bread, grain, roastiness, some sweetness and malts.
Not fan of this style but this beer is not bad.

[10/5/13] Bottle at the brewery in London. Brown with deep amber hues. Somewhat roasty aroma with malt and some earthy hints. Roasty flavor with a bit of coffee, dark bread, some hops, citric and a bit earthy, and a bitter finish. Medium-bodied. Quite nice.
Roasted and sour aroma, taste is roasted coffee, soft, smooth and balanced. Very clever and sophisticated, sessionable.
Bottled. A red brown beer with a tan head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, roasted malt, and bread, leading to a bitter finish.
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange to brown with a small tan head. Aroma is toasted malty, breadish and chocolate. Thick malty. Caramelish and toasted malty. Toffee. Bitter and dry into the finish.

bottle from Utobeer Market Stall, London, thanks to Edmunds 
Pours thick visually textured, deep brown-reddish with beige smooth thick long lasting foam, minimal lasing. Inside there are many little peaces of ? Aroma - starts as pure dak malt roasted, chocolate, later becomes more mild, more malty cocoa. Taste is light sweet with intense bitter from dark malt, but seems with no roast. Very thick-oily texture, close to full body, still it is soft to average carbonated with bitter light dry finish and not long but pleasant hops herbal and malt-chocolate bitter aftertaste. Interesting brew

Bottle. Bottled 19/06/13, BBE 19/06/14. Pours a dark brown with an auburn tinge. Large, big-bubbled, latte-colored head. Aroma is earthy, somewhat wooden, bready and dry. Light chocolate. Taste is earthy too, quite dry. Light, fruity sweetness. Some chocolate, light coffee, a lot of bready maltiness. Aftertaste has cacao and chocolate. Light with quite a bit of carbonation.
Dark amber With off white head - raosted malt aroma With some caramel as well - roasted malt and some caramel with a bitterness to go along - Nice malt finish - this was good
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Aroma is malty, chocolate and slightly roasty. A bit nutty and bready too. Taste is mild sweet. Not bad! Medium body with soft carbonation.

Bottle 330ml.Clear medium to dark brown colour with a small, open and fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, dark roasted. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration, dark roasted, chocolate, initial flavor is chlorine notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130629]

Bottle @ Home. Pours very dark brown with a small light brown head. Aroma of light roasted malt, chocolate, little dark fruits. Flavor is roasted malt, dark chocolate, light licorice, little dark fruits. Medium body, soft carbonation, light dry roasted finish. 060813

Bottle, many thanks to Scopey.  Hazy brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, dark fruits. Taste, roasted malt, coffee, licorice, burned sugar., cocoa, earthy notes. Coffee bitter finish. Alcohol is well hidden. Tasty.

Bottled, dated 19/06/2013, large sample. Clear dark redbrown color, medium frothy light brown head. Aroma of some roasted malts, coffee, whole grain cookie, hint of caramel. Smells like a porter (a 6.4% mild, thats rare anyway). Quite bitter taste, but mostly malt bitterness from the roast, slight sweetness from cara or biscuity malts. Could have been a bit more creamy or smooth, but overall its a very nice beer, although the term mild and the style mild ale seem to be a bit out of place. But who cares as long as the beer tastes good.

Bottle from cotteridge wines. Almost black beer with large head. Aroma of cocoa and roasted malts. Taste follows suit with roasted malts, cocoa and a touch of licorice. Medium bodied and smooth. Very good mild.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a very clear deep brown colour with a thin broken tan head and a thick rich consistency. The aroma is roasted malt and some chocolate notes. The flavour is medium bitter with lots of malts and liqourice on the super smooth and alcoholic palate. It is a really different and quite exceptional beer.
33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with jmgreenuk. Very thin off white head. Clear amber pour. Some chocolate. Nice brew.

Bottle at the brewery. Dark brown with orange tints and lace. Big malty nose, chocolate, light roast, bread. Rich, malty flavor, light fruit, roasty, nicely fruity and chocolaty. Porter-like. Unlike any mild I know, but very good.

Bottle from Sourced Market in St Pancras Station, London.
Poured a cloudy copper with a thin brown head. Malt grain aroma with a little hop bitterness. Sweet initial roasted caramel flavours offset by a burst of bitter hops. Balanced.

Bottle at Brewdog Camden. Dark brown, small golden head. Aroma is coffee and chocolate, roasty malt, bit of smoke and coffee. Taste is a bit more interesting, roasty, bit milky, touch of smoke, cola. Isnt this too strong to be a mild? But it is pretty nice.

Bottled on 19/06/13. Pours a cloudy brown which is a ruby red colour when held to light. Aroma is coffee, choc, candy, rich rye type bread, a little rum. Medium body, light carbonation. Lots of coffee, some choc, booze, rich fruitcake, rum. Its ever so slightly watery. Tasty.

Tap sample @ Haand Festival 2013. Pours a deep brown near-black body with a small white head. Aroma is smokey malts, caramel, dry chocolate and hints of ashes. Nice. Taste is ashy smoke and chocolate, hints of peat and licorice. Mild, but strong? Full body, medium carbonation. Interesting and tasty, and really smooth stuff.
Sample at Haand 2013. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, hop, caramel. Flavour is fruit, roasted malt, hop, caramel. Medium body. OK beer.
300713. Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with a small head. Aroma roasted malts, bread, Very grainy notes to it. Not Bad.

Bottle from Partizan. It pours cloudy deep brown with a small beige head. The nose is light roast, toast, caramel, dried fruit and liquorice. The taste is toast, earth, liquorice, brown bread, wood, burnt caramel, leaf, salt and decent bitterness with dry, bitter finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Comes together rather nicely. Good and tasty interp of the style.

330ml bottle from Ales by Mail

Pours dark brown, almost black with a small white head. Aroma of chocolatey malts, hints of caramel, chocolate and cocoa. Taste is smooth, mildly fruity and chocolatey with notes of roastiness, chocolate and cocoa. Finish is grainy with some cocoa, roastiness and coffee. Feels more like a brown ale than a mild, but quite balanced.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2013 Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Smells like a hardened leather satchel. Light tobacco and roast granite. Bitter malts - tangy. Some sweetness from errr, dont know; but in essence this is an English Strong Ale AKA strong Mild, characterised by the negative hop quotient. Nice.

Sample from bottle at Haand Festival 2013. Clear brown body, small tanned head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, pine. Malty taste with roast, lightly sweet, nuts and coffee. Strong bitterness, bitter and roasted finish.

Bottle. Very dark brown with an off white foam. Aromas are earthy with some barnyard funk and roast coffee and cocoa. Berries with light lemon and medicinal notes. Flavours are cola and coffee with gritty cocoa and some musty notes. Bitter lemon and green apple with hints of grapefruit. Nice.

My Bottom Line:
This super silky concoction relies on a dark malt blend which develops dark fruit, chocolate, licorice and caramel until peppery hops build balance in the finish.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy dollop of foam sits atop the gleaming dark brown.
-A mineral twang accompanies the hops in the finish.
-The mouthfeel is a tad sweetish, but it is remarkably silky and rich.
-This is the kind of grain bill we rarely taste in North America. Very interesting!

Bottle.

330 ml bottle.
Pours a dark murky brown colour with a small head. Aroma of burnt malts, rubber, chocolate and grass. Flavour is rather rich with burnt malts, grassy hops, dark chocolate, pungent grapefruit, soy sauce and some caramel. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Finishes lingering bitter and malty. Good.

33 cl bottle. Bottled on 16.04.2013. BBE 16.04.2014.
Pours dark brown color with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma of ripe fruits, some chocolate, caramel malts and toffee, some faint licorice notes as well. Flavor of sweet ripe fruits, caramel, nutty malts, faint licorice and subtle chocolate notes. Almost creamy and somewhat chocolaty smooth palate, mild bitter fruity finish. Nice.
4325

Bottled (thanks laiti!). Deep coppery brown colour, small beige head. Aroma is nutty, toffee, some floral and fruity notes along with mild roast. Flavour is quite floral with some bready and ryelike notes as well as mild toasted notes.

33 cl bottle @ oh6gdx. Bottled 16.04.2013, BBE 16.04.2014
Aroma has nuts, some toffee and hints of hay. Flavour has toffee, some cereal, coffee, nuts and licorice. Finishes with herbal notes. Nice.
33cl, new exclusive English brew Anno 2013, from The Bottle Shop Canterbury, complex brew, malty/sweet and slightly roasted/salty, balanced, hazy, small head, nice brew
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, rich nuts, caramel, fruits and has a nice dry finish. A little licorice as well.
Bottle. Dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel and a little bread. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, little bread, little sweet and a little bitter.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, roasted malt and chocolate. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter. 290613

Bottle bought at Real ale shop, Twickenham. A dark brown coloured pour with a thin white head on top. Roasty, malty, coffee aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, coffee, dark fruit, slight sweetness in there. Decent.

Bottle 330ml @ Haand Ølfestival 2013
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long chocolate and caramel finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Improves by being a warmer so dont drink too cold. Quite fruity, some funky wood shavings, grain, raspberries. Quite good.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2013 Bottle cheers to Jack from Partizan Brewery. Pours pretty much opaque black with a small tan head. Nose is quite burnt smelling - burnt toffee, ashy, roasted malts, dark chocolate. Taste is predominately coffee and biscuit with some light bitterness coming from cocoa notes. Very easy drinking with good flavour. Solid stuff
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. A very dark brown hazy beer with chocolate, slight sour red fruit and malty flavours, a creamy mouthfeel and a bitter roasted finish.

Sampled @ Haand 2013. Dark brown body with an off-white head. Nica aroma of malt light roasted, fruit, toast and hint of caramel. Flavor is sweet, soft roasted malt, fruit and balanced bitterness. OK medium body and decent aftertaste. A nice, easy drinkable one without being outrageous.

Bottle from Brixton Market. Colour is dark brown opaque, thin off white head. Nose is black coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate. Taste is black coffee, roasted malt, and some dry chewy hops, but primarily coffee. Its very nice and as much of a porter than a mild, although body is light, nicely carbonated. Finish is dry roasted malt, slightly dark fruity and dry hop on the tongue.

Bottle from the brewery at home. Clear caramel brown colour whispy beige head. Aroma is complex soft coffee jar, choc sweet caramel. Flavour is rich choc, caramel with a touch of salt. Some berry in the finish. Medium carbonation. Really good mild.

330ml bottle. Clear darkest ruby red colour with small to average, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Dark malty aroma with a nuttily touch, hints of chocolate and roast. Taste is monotonously dry roasty dark malty, subtle hints of coffee. Nice taste with astonishing constancy, complete lack of development. Nevertheless a nice one.

Bottle at home, 08/06/13, from Utobeer.
Extremely dark mahogony brown with reddish hues when held to the light, mahoooosive light tan head.
Nose carries a good dose of roast malt, burnt toffee, biscuit, dark chocolate, background coffee - the latter two subtle but meld well on top of the former.
Taste comprises roast malt, coffee comes into play more, biscuit, light bitter chocolate notes, dark fruits.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry finish with a good dose of bitterness.
A most tasty mild, breaking the usual ABV boundaries somewhat and overly bitter for a trad mild, but I really enjoyed this!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 7th June 2013Almost opaque dark brown beer, little pale tan head. Palate is light and and a little dry. Mild and thin malt cream with traces of coffee and dark chocolate. Well buried dark fruits and a somewhat bitter finish which also reveals a touch of red berry fruits. Strong bitter linger. Interesting mild but the bitterness is a tad aggressive.

Sample from bottle at Haand Festival 2014
Dark brown, chalk white head. Smells of grain, hints of roast and caramel. Quite dry, moderate sweet, nice malt flavors and some roast again. Moderate bitter. Very nice, not soo mild
Bottle at the brewery Dark beer. very dry very choccy very drinkable. Gorgeous dark choc. So good

33cl bottle at the brewery. It pours brown with ruby edges. Foam is thin, with large beige bubbles. Aroma is quite light and sweet-ish. Some roasted malts but more chocolate notes. Taste is more deep and robust with chocolate and espresso, some roast and a general sweetness cut through by a very decent acidity. Body is quite thin and carbonation is light, maybe too much to me. Overall, tastes like a watered down porter to me.

Sampled from tap at Haandøl 2013. Clear deep mahogany body with a large creamy tan colored head leaving excellent lacing. Toasted dark bread and nuts on the nose. Light notes of roasted black pepper and toasted earthy bitter flavors in the mouth. Medium to full bodied. Dry tongue.

330ml bottle.  Pours very dark brown with a large head.  Aroma is cola and caramel, with a touch of smoked ham.  Taste has cola and caramel to start with a smoked ham finish and more Coke on the finish.
On tap from Haand Festival 2013. Pours dark ruby with a small off white head. Aroma of roasted malts and some toffee notes. Low carbonation, medium bitterness, medium body,. Easy to drink.

Bottle, at Haand Festival. Its an unclear, brown beer topped by a minimal sized off-white head. The aroma is mostly roasted, with some toffee and pine cones. Mostly roasted flavor too, some bitterness bringing a bit of balance, and also the same toffee and pine cones found in the aroma. More or less full bodied, dryish and pleasantly carbonated. Bitter finish. A tasteful and easy drinkable beer, but not very exiting anyway. 130524
On tap at Haand13. Pours dark ruby with a small off-white head. Aroma is chewy malts, toffee and roast. Taste is like a mild porter, dry roasted and toasted, lovely.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 25.05.2013, tap @ HaandFestival:
Small shortlasting head. Aroma is sweet, roasted dark malts, coffee, dark sugar, caramel, grain, chocolate, grass. Taste is slightly watery, roasted dark malts, grass, dark sugar, nuts, caramel, coffee. Medium bitterness and dryness. Nice mild.

Sample from bottle at Haand Beer Festival 2013, Drammen. Dark ruby colour, nearly black. Moderate beige head. Dryish roasty aroma, notes of mild coffee, a hint of liquorice. Very smooth and medium dry flavour, mild roasty notes throughout.

On bottle at Haand Festival 2013. Darle brown color, good offwhite foam. Roasted aromas , coffee, licorice & malt. Médium body & complexity. Well balanced. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Haandfestivalen. Lys svart farge. Hvit skumtopp. Brent malt , humle. Smaker som en ganske mild stout. Mørk og forfriskende
More of a golden ale than a mild, but who am I to argue. Has some roasted malt qualities.

Mild. Im mildly offensive. Ian MacKaye wrote the following...

Compete, compete, do it for the boys
Empty barrels make the most noise
Youre always on the move
Youve always got something to prove

What the fuck are you fighting for?
Is it because youre five foot four?
You better be happy with what youve got
Youll never get any more

You laugh at a man when he tries
Youre trying to make up for your size
To you life is a rivalry
Keep a step ahead of me

I like this beer but it doesnt make me feel as good as listening to Minor Threat. Partizan equals mild. MT equals ferocious ball of energy. Hardcore.

Bottle at home in London - snagged from the brewery. Pours clear, red-brown with a lasting, tight creamy yellow-beige head. Brown bread in the nose, some ripe - and almost rotting - fruits, soft toast. Light to medium sweet flavor with well toasted brown bread, some mellow earthy and dirty bitterness, dried and ripened berries, some leather. Light to medium bodied with fine, smooth carbonation. Moderate toasty bread sweetness to finish, more earthy bitterness, leathery fruits, mild mustiness, suggestions of the alcohol, some mellow cocoa. Another solid offering from Partizan.

Bottle @ Partizan Brewery. The pours deep brown with a small tan head. The nose is cola bottle candy, some brown bread toast, sweet bubblegum and fruit & nut chocolate bar. Hints of red berry, grape. The taste is nutella-slathered brown toast. Smooth and nutty. Light, nimble body. Some red fruits and more bubblegum. Soft carbonation. Rich without being cloying. Overall, a really nice effort. Great, in fact.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, dark brown pour with foam magnolia head, sweet chocolate and coffee aroma, sweet porter like taste with chocolate and coffee a couple of milds recently that taste like porters. Very good regardless of style.
